content: How can I implement the logistic sigmoid function in Python? I know the value of x, and I'd like to calculate F(x) where F(x) represents the logistic sigmoid function given by the formula displayed in the image [here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/SUuRi.png). For instance, if x = 0.458, what would be the value of F(x)?

To implement the logistic sigmoid function in Python, you can use the formula:

\[ F(x) = \frac{1}{1 + e^{-x}} \]

Here's how you can implement it and calculate \( F(x) \) for \( x = 0.458 \):

```python
import math

def sigmoid(x):
    return 1 / (1 + math.exp(-x))

x = 0.458
result = sigmoid(x)
print(f"F({x}) = {result}")
```

When you run this code, it will calculate and print the value of the logistic sigmoid function for \( x = 0.458 \).
